column4: sorry to be pushy guys.. but im really stressed out. I have windows xp on one harddrive and i just installed ubuntu onto a blank harddrive that i just connected to my computer, but when i try to start up, my BIOS doesn't recognize my new harddrive and i get a Grub Error 21... can someone help me please???
if you're in need of booting to something, try XP recovery console or Super GRUB CD
fixmbr at XP recovery console so you can boot to something
pop in your XP CD, at the installation screen, press R, then C
when you reach the temrinal, fixmbr
that should get you back the ability to boot to P
you may try the Super GRUB CD
works off of a CD and USB I believe
the Super GRUB CD is a CD that lets you restore bootability and lets you boot an arbitrary partition
if your BIOS isn't recognizing your HDD, how do you have it hooked up?
does your BIOS detect your new HDD at all?
perhaps you should check your BIOS settings in regards to SATA
if the BIOS cannot see your device, I believe GRUB will not be able to either
other than that, I unfortunately do not know too much with regards to your issue :(
because Linux initializes devices independently of the BIOS
